item.title: Poppy Playtime Chapter 4: How To Escape The Toy Cage Maze
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Escape the Cage Maze in Poppy Playtime Chapter 4

After making a trip through the operating room in Poppy Playtime Chapter 4 , the Doctor pulls one final move on players, trapping them in an underground cage maze. The cages are filled with violent critters, but that's the least of our worries. After Yarnby, the Doctor decides to let loose another one of his pets, a goat nightmare critter by the name of Baba Chops. The only way you can escape this maze is to find the batteries and restore the power to the locked door.

How to Escape the Cage Maze in Poppy Playtime Chapter 4

Once you drop into the cage, you'll be constantly pursued by the nightmare critter , and it'll throw acidic spit that will damage you as well as decrease movement speed. Since your right hand is disabled by the Doctor, you'll have to rely on your left hand to do all the work.

Start by looking into openings inside the cages to find a battery . Once you find it, insert it in any of the empty slots and divert power to other cages in the maze to get more batteries from them. Once you have enough, then you'll need to do some tasks before escaping the cage maze in Poppy Playtime Chapter 4 .

Open the Gate & Get the Keycard

Once you have enough batteries plugged into the wall, the first thing you'll need to do is restore power to the gate . Try to follow the wires coming out of the electric panels on the sides of the gate and find the electric router to divert power to them.

You can remove and install batteries from one socket to another to get current flowing in the desired set of wires.

Once both of the electric panels for the gate are powered, you'll need to head inside and pick up a keycard beside the body.

Restore Power to the Locked Door

Once you have the keycard, locate the locked door in the maze with an electric panel on the left, and a keycard console on the right. Use the keycard on the console and follow the wires coming out of the panels to their respective electric routers.

Once the door is powered, head inside to destroy the last organ of the Doctor. However, the organ is replaced with a nightmare critter and the Doctor tries to give players a choice to either spare the life of the critter, in exchange for their own, or take a life to save themselves.

Once the cutscene is over, nightmare critters will start breaking into the room, so you'll have to make a quick choice. As you'll only die if you don't proceed with the plan, quickly grab the plug and insert it into the containment unit to kill the critter. Once that happens, you'll be able to escape the cage maze and proceed to the next area in Poppy Playtime Chapter 4 .

item.title: Infinity Nikki Promises Major Change to Outfit Slots
item.description:
Summary

  • Infinity Nikki will add more outfit slots in the near future, a highly requested feature by players globally.
  • It may require Diamonds or Blings to unlock the slots.
  • Future plans for 2025 include the completion of the housing feature and a new region for Nikki to explore.

Infinity Nikki has confirmed that a future update will finally add one of the most requested features by the community: more outfit slots. With Update 1.2 underway in Infinity Nikki , it's clear that the latest installment in the Nikki franchise is aiming for the stars. By combining its predecessor's dress-up elements with a vibrant open world, Infinity Nikki was able to capture a wide audience at launch, and the game continues to maintain its momentum with ambitious content updates.

Update 1.2 for Infinity Nikki notably added a whole new area in Wishfield, allowing players to explore the Firework Isles and engage with more powerful enemies, solve new puzzles, and expand their ability set with a Fireworks ability. It also put Marques Jr. in a starring role, with Nikki helping him reconcile his childhood trauma while embarking on an adventure to answer one of the island's oldest mysteries. While Infinity Nikki continues to grow as a game, many players feel like the developers at Infold severely misjudged one gameplay feature in specific.

Despite being a game that places great emphasis on dressing up in a wide variety of outfits, there are only four outfit slots for Infinity Nikki players to work with. Needless to say, audiences from across the globe and in China have both demanded more outfit slots since the game's launch, and Infinity Nikki finally gave them an answer on Weibo, shared by gggary1230 on Reddit. While the developers haven't given an exact date, Infold has confirmed that more outfit slots will be coming to Infinity Nikki . Considering the banner schedule for Infinity Nikki , as well as the sheer quantity of free outfits obtainable via gameplay, this feature is certainly needed sooner rather than later.

Infinity Nikki Will Add More Outfit Slots in a Future Update

While Infinity Nikki will have more outfit slots in the near future, Infold has provided no details on how this change will be implemented. There is a chance that players will need to use Diamonds or Blings to unlock new outfit slots, but given Infold's determination to add more quality-of-life features to Infinity Nikki , it's quite likely that the outfit slots will be retroactively added to the game's user interface.

Update 1.3 will be released in late February, and recent datamining points towards the housing feature in Infinity Nikki almost being complete as well. Assuming that Infold stays true to its road map for 2025, players can expect to see Nikki in a whole new region by the end of Summer 2025. Hopefully, by that time, she will have more outfit slots to work with.

item.title: Fortnite OG: 10 Best Weapons in Chapter 1 Season 2
item.description:
Summary

  • Tactical Submachine Gun is best for close-quarters, but not the highest DPS.
  • Semi-Auto Pistol serves as a good spray weapon, comparable to an SMG.
  • Burst Assault Rifle hits hard, ideal for medium range, but is less forgiving than the standard Assault Rifle.

Fortnite OG sends players back to the original Chapter 1 map where it all began, running alongside Chapter 6. Players diving into Fortnite OG will be greeted with a fresh nostalgia trip, embarking on a journey across some familiar locations and mechanics—this time enhanced by the updated Chapter 5 movement system, keeping the game fast-paced and ramping up the action.

In addition to the return of the very first Fortnite Battle Royale map, players can also get their hands on a whole roster of legacy weapons that function almost identically to their Chapter 1, Season 2 counterparts. Of course, with a diverse loot pool, the meta of Fortnite OG is bound to differ from Chapter 6. While the choice of weapons ultimately comes down to personal preference, some options are undeniably better than others. Here are the best Fortnite OG weapons for Chapter 1 Season 2, ranked.

Updated on January 31, 2025, by Nathan Round: Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 2 has marked its debut, bringing with it iconic locations like Tilted Towers, along with a roster of updates to the loot pool. This list has been updated to include additional weapons, as well as provide updated stats for many of the existing weapons that carried over from Season 1.

Despite this flaw, as a starter weapon, the Tactical Submachine Gun does its job fairly well, serving as an excellent spray weapon, especially when paired with a Pump Shotgun. item.title: Call of Duty Fan Shows Off Real-Life Mystery Box
item.description:
Summary

  • A Call of Duty fan received a life-sized Mystery Box as a gift, replicating the in-game item.
  • The fan-made Mystery Box sparked interest on Reddit, earning praise for its accuracy and details.
  • Call of Duty Black Ops 6's Season 2 update includes new content and anti-cheat measures for players.

A Call of Duty enthusiast has received a life-sized Mystery Box, an in-game item featured throughout the series, as a gift from a loved one. The Mystery Box appears primarily in Zombies maps and is present across various Call of Duty titles, including the latest one, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 .

Since being introduced in 2008's Call of Duty: World at War , the Zombies mode has grown in popularity among Call of Duty fans and has become a staple for the FPS franchise over time. For that reason, devs keep making fresh content for this mode with each new Call of Duty season, ensuring players don't get bored with gunning down hordes of the undead. Throughout these years, one of the consistent elements in the Zombies maps has been the Mystery Box, a container that conjures up a random weapon for the player to use. Recently, one passionate fan showed a real-world Mystery Box, bringing the iconic in-game item to life.

In a Reddit post, user cruzer58b showcased their Mystery Box replica gifted by their fiancé. The full-size wooden box accurately represents the in-game item found in certain Call of Duty maps, complete with a pair of big yellow question marks. Similar to the one found in Zombies maps, it also comes equipped with a lock for securing the box. Notably, there are thin black handles on both ends of the container. As an added detail, the fan-made Mystery Box sports certain relevant text stamped on it, including the words "Prestige Master," which is the highest rank obtainable in Call of Duty games. In one of the replies, cruzer58b revealed plans to equip the box with enhancements, such as a speaker to play the Mystery Box sound as featured in the game. Moreover, they said that they may eventually use the wooden casket to store their games and COD -related collectibles.

Fan-Made Call of Duty Mystery Box Earns Praise from Other Players

The life-sized Mystery Box built by the longtime Call of Duty player's fiancé generated considerable interest in the blackops6 subreddit. Most comments heaped praise on the efforts put into the box, with one of them calling it "pretty cool." Similar to this, several other creations have previously wowed the game's fans on the internet. For instance, a Call of Duty fan's recreation of the poster found in one of the Zombies maps received quite a lot of views on Reddit as well.

Recently, Call of Duty Black Ops 6 's Season 2 went live, adding a plethora of new content to the game, ranging from new weapons to a new Zombies map. Apart from shipping a slew of new in-game items in the latest update, devs have importantly also integrated some anti-cheat measures to ensure an improved online experience for COD players.

item.title: How Marvel Rivals' Ult Voice Lines Compare to Overwatch 2's
item.description:
Marvel Rivals Season 1, "Eternal Night Falls," has been immensely successful. After an impressive debut with a high player count in Season 0 last December, Marvel Rivals set the new gold standard for live service launches. As one of the latest and most popular additions to the hero-shooter genre, the excitement surrounding NetEase Games' title is not slowing down anytime soon.

Though comparisons between Overwatch 2 and Marvel Rivals haven't always been helpful, it is compelling to examine where each game excels and where they may fall short. As two standout titles in this niche, both games offer unique environments and characters. The way they handle ultimate voice lines, for example, is especially intriguing.

How Marvel Rivals and Overwatch 2 Handle Ultimate Lines Uniquely

Marvel Rivals and Overwatch 2's Most Complicated Ultimate Lines

With Marvel Rivals still in Season 1 and many of its players new to the hero-shooter genre, keeping track of which ultimate voice lines are friendly and which are from an enemy can be difficult. In particular, voice lines for characters like Venom and Groot have the potential to be confusing, as their phrasing doesn't differ much. Some players have criticized enemy ultimate voice lines for not being distinct enough from ally ones, making them harder to differentiate.

Some of the most difficult-to-discern ultimate lines in Marvel Rivals are as follows:

Enemy Voice Line

Ally Voice Line

Cloak & Dagger

"Us against the world!"

"It's co-op time!"

Groot

"We are Groot!"

"I am Groot!"

Hawkeye

"Woo! I never miss!"

"Here's how you shoot!"

Jeff the Land Shark

"Om, nom, nom!"

"Yummy, yummy!"

Mantis

"We are undefeatable!"

"Friends, gather around!"

Namor

*Horn noise*

*Horn noise*

Peni Parker

"It's Spider-Time!"

"Spider Mode!"

Venom

"We are Venom!"

"We hunger!"

Wolverine

*Growling* "Rnngh, Raaah!"

"Berserker Rage!"

Namor stands out in Marvel Rivals with his high win rate and the absence of any voice line during his ultimate. While his ultimate, Horn of Proteus, summons Giganto to deal damage to enemies around the targeted location, the horn noise is rather brief and can be lost in the clutter of other sound effects. Comparably, Wolverine's enemy ultimate line also lacks distinguishable words, yet it feels reminiscent of certain voice lines in Overwatch 2 , like Winston's Primal Rage ultimate, where he roars but doesn't necessarily say anything.

Though there are some variations of the lines that will play when in-game, especially if players are in the support role, a few similarly confusing ultimate lines in Overwatch 2 are as follows:

"B.O.B., do something!"

"Activating self-destruct sequence!"

"Meteor strike!"

"Incoming!"

"Whe-whe-whe-wheee-whee-wheee!"

"Whe-whe-whe-wheee-whee-wheee!"

"Adaptive circuits engaged: *insert hero*!"

"Duplicating: *insert hero*"

Junker Queen

"Time for the reckoning!"

"Let's take them to the Wasteland!"

"Fire in the hole!"

"Ladies and gentlemen, start your engines!"

"Hammer down!"

"For the Crusaders!"

*Laughter*

"Unloading scrap!"

"This ends now!"

*Roar*

*Roar*

*Squeaking* "Area denied!"

"Mine field deployed!"

Marvel Rivals Ultimate Lines Differ In One Major Way

It is worth noting that in both games, the ultimate voice lines truly shine when an enemy shouts, which signifies the use of their ultimate voice by shouting in their native language. To illustrate, when playing Psylocke in Marvel Rivals , she shouts "Cho no mai o kurae!" when targeting enemies and "Watch me soar!" when aiding allies. Iron Fist is the only other character in the game who uses his native language for his ultimate, yelling "Qi guan chang hong!" as an enemy and "The Dragon unleashed!" when on the team’s side.

In contrast, Overwatch uses this tool with ultimate lines much more often, with heroes like Hanzo, Genji, Mei, Mercy, Widowmaker, and Zarya highlighting this. Perhaps in the future, Marvel Rivals will take a page out of Blizzard's book and create more differentiating dialogue for these critical moments. Furthermore, in Overwatch 2 , players can hear all ultimates being used, regardless of their position on the map. In contrast, Marvel Rivals seemingly only plays ultimate voice lines for players close enough to the action.
